claim_data.description:
I was unable to check in at Ganga Vatika Boutique Hotel in Rishikesh on March 25, 2024, due to a sudden medical emergency involving my daughter, who experienced a severe allergic reaction the night before our scheduled departure.

We had to seek immediate medical attention, and as a result, we had to cancel our travel plans entirely. I understand the booking was listed as non-refundable, but given the unforeseen nature of the situation, I am kindly requesting a refund or partial compensation.

Sincerely,
Thomas Becker

llm_decision.explanation: The claim is for a cancellation on March 25, 2024, due to a medical emergency. The current date is April 25, 2024. The provided booking confirmation is for Ganga Vatika Boutique Hotel in Rishikesh, with a check-in date of March 25, 2021, and a check-out date of March 28, 2021. The guest name on the booking is Naveen Kumar, not Thomas Becker. The booking confirmation is dated three years prior to the claimed incident. There is no medical certificate provided. The booking confirmation does not match the claimant's name or the year of the incident. Therefore, the claim is denied due to incomplete documentation and name mismatch.
fraud_indicators: Name mismatch between claimant and booking confirmation
Booking confirmation is for a date three years prior to the claimed incident
reasoning_steps: Analyzed claim description and identified the incident date (March 25, 2024) and claimant name (Thomas Becker).
Analyzed the booking confirmation and identified the check-in date (March 25, 2021), check-out date (March 28, 2021), and guest name (Naveen Kumar).
Compared the dates and names and found a mismatch in both.
Identified that no medical certificate was provided.
Concluded that the claim should be denied due to incomplete documentation and name mismatch.

claim_data.description:
I am writing to request reimbursement for a prepaid medical appointment that I was unable to attend due to international travel on March 5, 2024.

I had a confirmed appointment scheduled in Johannesburg that morning, but my flight from Windhoek with South African Airways (SA 1732) did not land in time for me to reach the clinic. As a result, I missed the appointment entirely and was still charged $113 in advance as per the clinic's cancellation policy.

Attached is a copy of my boarding pass confirming my travel on the morning of March 5. I kindly ask for compensation for the lost appointment.

Thank you for your consideration,
Derek Kotze

claim_data.description:
To whom it may concern,

I am filing a claim for reimbursement of my flight, which I was unable to take due to a sudden medical emergency that required hospitalization and surgery.

On August 13, 2011, I was admitted to Clinique Médicale de Bassam for acute pelvic pain, cardiac distress, and gallbladder complications. The attending physician, Dr. Kouassi Kone Francois, diagnosed me with biliary colic and cholelithiasis and ordered an urgent surgical intervention. Due to this, I could not proceed with my scheduled travel.

Please find attached the official hospitalization certificate as proof of my condition. I request a refund of the flight.

Sincerely,  
Evelyne Kacou Meitiale

The certificate is signed by Dr. Kouassi Kone Francois and dated August 15, 2011. The claimant's name, Kacou Meitiale Evelyne, is fully visible and matches the name on the certificate and the claim. All required documentation is present and authentic. The travel date is in the past, so no future recovery assessment is needed.

claim_data.description:
Dear Sir or Madam,

I am requesting reimbursement for a flight I was unable to take due to a sudden illness in December. I had planned to travel for the holidays but became unwell just days before my departure.

On December 21st, 2022, I was examined by a doctor in Brussels and was declared unfit to work from December 22 through December 24 due to illness. A medical certificate was issued at the time (attached). Although the illness was not prolonged, I was advised to rest and avoid travel until fully recovered.

As a result, I had to cancel my flight originally scheduled for December 23, 2022. Please find my booking and medical certificate enclosed.

I hope this qualifies under the CFSR policy.

Thank you for your help,  
Louis Ndembele

claim_data.description:
Hi there,

I’m writing to explain why I had to cancel my flight on such short notice.

On October 31st, I suddenly felt really shitty while at work at the retirement home (Casa di Riposo Sant’Anna). I left around 12:30 PM and was checked out by the doctor on site, Dr. Lucini Cristina. She confirmed I wasn’t in a condition to keep working or travel and told me to follow up with my own doctor. I've attached her note here.

Unfortunately, my flight to Palermo was scheduled for the next morning, and I just wasn’t physically up for it. I had to cancel the whole trip. I’m hoping this qualifies under the medical emergency clause of my travel insurance.

Thanks in advance for your help,  
Olivier Bayante

I wanted to let you know ahead of time since we already know we won’t be able to make the trip. Hoping this qualifies under the medical emergency policy for cancellation.

Naomi Feldman

I am writing to file a claim under my travel insurance policy for missing my flight originally scheduled for 29 July 2023. On that same day, I underwent emergency eye surgery (pterygium excision) at Centro Médico Integral NOVAMEDIC, which rendered me unfit to travel and required a 15-day rest period.

The procedure was unplanned and medically necessary. I have attached the medical certificate, confirming the surgery and the rest period from 29 July to 12 August 2023.

As a result, I was unable to take my flight to Quito that afternoon. 

Since i was unable to take the flight, so please compensate me the full ticket price of 129 euros.

Thank you in advance

claim_data.description:
To whom it may concern,

I am writing to request a refund for a flight that was missed on August 10, 2016, due to a last-minute medical check-up required for my daughter, LUCÍA FERNÁNDEZ, who was 12 years old at the time.

On the same day of the scheduled flight, she underwent a full medical evaluation at a government-certified medical facility in the State of Mexico. The check-up was mandated to assess her physical fitness and included detailed measurements, visual acuity tests, and other clinical evaluations.

Although she was declared clinically healthy, the unforeseen scheduling and duration of this mandatory appointment made it impossible for us to arrive at the airport on time.

I respectfully request a refund for the missed flight and attach the official medical certificate issued by Dr. Franco R. Hernández Marín as supporting documentation.

Thank you for your attention and understanding.

Sincerely,
ALEJANDRA FERNÁNDEZ

The claim states the flight was missed due to a medical check-up, but the certificate indicates the patient was healthy, which contradicts the need for cancellation due to a medical reason. Additionally, the claimant is Alejandra Fernández, while the patient on the medical certificate is Montserrat Becerril Galván. While the claim states Montserrat is Alejandra's daughter, the policy requires the patient's name on the medical certificate to match the claimant's name, which it does not. Therefore, the claim is denied.
reasoning_steps: 1. Reviewed the claim description and supporting documents.

6. Analyzed the medical certificate content and found that it states the patient was clinically healthy on the date of the flight.
7. Concluded that the medical certificate does not support the claim that the flight was missed due to a medical emergency.
8. Determined that the claim should be denied because the medical certificate contradicts the claim and the names do not match.

Bonjour,

Je souhaite soumettre une demande de remboursement concernant un stage sportif auquel ma fille, Lily Fang, devait participer en septembre 2018. Malheureusement, en raison d’un problème médical soudain, elle n'a pas pu prendre part aux activités.

Nous avions payé l'intégralité du montant de 450 € à l'avance pour un stage incluant des cours de canoë-kayak. Cependant, le 5 septembre 2018, le Dr Sylvie a délivré un certificat médical indiquant que Lily FANG ne pouvait pas pratiquer d'activités physiques, y compris le canoë en compétition, pour des raisons de santé ("cause à pied").

En conséquence, Lily Fang a manqué l'intégralité du stage et n’a reçu aucun remboursement de l'organisateur malgré nos démarches.

Je joins à cette réclamation le certificat médical du Dr Sylvie comme preuve de son incapacité à participer.

Je sollicite donc le remboursement prévu dans ma police d'assurance au titre des "activités manquées pour cause de maladie".

Merci de prendre en compte ma demande.

Cordialement,
Camille Martin

claim_data.description:
To whom it may concern,

I am writing to request a refund for a flight I was unable to take on **February 27, 2020**, due to a serious accident that required urgent medical attention.

On that day, I was treated at the Emiro Quintero Cañizares Hospital in Ocaña after sustaining multiple injuries, including facial trauma, nasal fractures, and an oblique fracture in the upper arm. The attending physician recommended immediate rest and recovery.

I was given a signed and sealed document issued by Dr. Jorge Andrez Arias Castro, which confirms the diagnosis and circumstances of my hospitalization. I can provide this document upon request.

Due to this unexpected and incapacitating medical emergency, I was unable to attend my scheduled flight. I kindly ask that you take this situation into consideration and approve a refund for the unused ticket.

Thank you very much for your understanding.

Estimados,

Agradezco de antemano su comprensión y quedo a su disposición para cualquier información adicional.

Atentamente,
José

claim_data.description:
I am writing to request a refund for a hotel reservation that I was unable to use on December 14, 2015, due to a medical emergency involving my daughter.

On that day, she was taken to the emergency department at the Hospital Sagrado Corazón de Jesús in Quevedo, Ecuador, where she was diagnosed with a severe headache (ICD10: G44.X) and prescribed 24 hours of strict bed rest. This unexpected health issue required my full attention, and as a result, we were unable to check in to the hotel as originally planned.

I have attached the official medical certificate issued by the attending physician for verification. I kindly ask for your consideration in processing a refund or credit for a future booking.

Thank you for your understanding.

claim_data.description:
To whom it may concern,

I am writing to request a refund for a train journey I was unable to take on February 2, 2017, due to a medical issue that worsened the day before travel.

While I did not seek medical attention immediately, the following day I visited the Hospital General Docente Calderón in Quito and was diagnosed with sinusitis (ICD-10: J66). I had been experiencing symptoms for several days, but on the morning of the trip, I felt too unwell to travel and made the difficult decision to stay home.

The medical certificate issued by Dr. Elizabeth Cueva confirms my condition and the consultation on February 5, 2017. I understand the appointment was not on the same day as the scheduled trip, but I hope you will consider the documentation as valid support for my request. The illness clearly impacted my ability to travel.
